headline: PUSH THE BUTTON
description: An evocative chronicle of building a simple LED circuit with a button, framed as both a technical journey and a metaphor for human-machine initiation. This post captures the spark of learning in its rawest form.
timeFelt: A moment of creative ignition—excited, reverent, and alive with symbolic potential.
whyItMatters: This post marks a pivotal first success in learning electronics from scratch. It reflects the idea that pressing a literal button can initiate symbolic transformation—of the project, the learner, and the machine.
articleExcerpt: It’s a crude circuit. A basic loop. But this is the first moment it’s really mine. That I felt like I really pressed the button.
sourceFragments: Discussion of LED polarity and current loop principles.
Reflections on creative emergence through physical work.
